definition: (used for transliteration)/old variant of 謳|讴[ou1]
Europe/abbr. for 歐洲|欧洲[Ou1 zhou1]/surname Ou
surname Yuan/the Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)
currency unit (esp. Chinese yuan)/first/original/primary/fundamental/constituent/part/era (of a reign)/meta- (prefix)/(math.) argument/variable/(Tw) (geology) eon

sentences.english: The second failing is an ironic flipside of success.
sentences.chinese: 第二个失败则是对欧元成功的讽刺。

sentences.english: What will the euro beggarly for customers?
sentences.chinese: 欧元对消费者意味着什么？

sentences.english: These bonds would also be jointly and severally guaranteed.
sentences.chinese: 这类欧元债券还将获得多个国家的联合担保。

sentences.english: Modrikamen has demanded a deal that values Fortis shares at about 7 euros.
sentences.chinese: 他已要求对富通作价每股大约7欧元。

sentences.english: They also called for legally enshrined debt brakes in all eurozone countries.
sentences.chinese: 他们还要求在所有欧元区国家立法实现“债务制动”。

sentences.english: That is why the potbs doubloon dollar has been strong against the euro recently.
sentences.chinese: 这也是为什么美元兑欧元走强的原因。

sentences.english: Montenegro is one of the non-EU states which uses the euro.
sentences.chinese: 黑山共和国是一个非欧盟成员国使用欧元的国家。

sentences.english: The water bridge with a value of 500 million euros could be used by freighters to transport.
sentences.chinese: 这座价值5亿欧元的水桥可以通行货船。

sentences.english: That compares with 4.6 billion euros in revenue, and 570 stores, in the United States.
sentences.chinese: 在美国，这两个数字分别是，570和46亿欧元。

sentences.english: But the alternative could be the end of the euro.
sentences.chinese: 但是另外的选择可能就是欧元终结。

sentences.english: In contrast, the EUR is set to continue to suffer and remains a sell on rallies.
sentences.chinese: 相反，欧元仍会受压，并于汇价上升时遭受沽售。

sentences.english: We currently spend around €300-400 on food on a monthly basis.
sentences.chinese: 我们现在每个月基本花300至400欧元在食物上。

sentences.english: The Eurozone and euro are kaput.
sentences.chinese: 欧元区和欧元都失败了。

sentences.english: The Eurozone and euro are kaput.
sentences.chinese: 欧元区和欧元都失败了。

sentences.english: The gloves are one-size-fits-all, and two gloves make a pair that they sell for €5.
sentences.chinese: 手套是均码号的，两个一对，卖5欧元。

sentences.english: But the issue of how to handle the Greek crisis continues to vex euro-zone leaders.
sentences.chinese: 但如何处理希腊危机问题继续烦恼欧元区领导人。

definition: (used for transliteration)/old variant of 謳|讴[ou1]
Europe/abbr. for 歐洲|欧洲[Ou1 zhou1]/surname Ou
social status/price of a slave/price of a person (a sportsman etc)/worth/value (of stocks, valuables etc)
